channel.title: Ride Bu
channel.description: OHHHHHHH, Who lives in a pineapple under the sea?

item.title: Install Oracle Linux 7.4
item.description:
Learning to install operation systme is the first step to use a server or computer.
## Installation ### Language
![oraclelinux-1.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-1.jpg)
![oraclelinux-2.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-2.jpg)
### INSTALLATION DESTINATION
![oraclelinux-3.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-3.jpg)
![oraclelinux-4.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-4.jpg)
![oraclelinux-5.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-5.jpg)
![oraclelinux-6.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-6.jpg)
### SOFTWARE SELECTION Depends on your purpose. For me, I only need the default installation.
![oraclelinux-7.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-7.jpg)
![oraclelinux-8.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-8.jpg)
### NETWORK & HOST NAME
![oraclelinux-9.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-9.jpg)
![oraclelinux-10.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-10.jpg)
![oraclelinux-11.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-11.jpg)
![oraclelinux-12.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-12.jpg)
### Begin Installation Set root password.
![oraclelinux-14.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-14.jpg)
### Done!
![oraclelinux-17.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-17.jpg)
![oraclelinux-21.jpg](http://localhost:4000/assets/images/oraclelinux-21.jpg)

item.title: Web Console
item.description:
This is what I did on the fist day in Intel. Use the Integrated BMC Web Console, and install operating system.

BIOS Configuration

Server Management

Click BMC LAN Configuration

Set a proper IP address

Set user ID and password

User state: enable

F10 Save configuration

Remote Control

Java configuration

Add IP address of the server

Open web console and Login

Now you can use the server while drinking coffee!

item.title: Hello World - Bu
item.description:
What’s this

Vno Jekyll is a theme for Jekyll. It is a port of my Ghost theme vno, which is originally developed from Dale Anthony’s Uno.

Great thanks to Onevcat
